description: Indulge in a cup of rich peppermint hot cocoa that rivals your favorite coffee shop. This cozy drink is perfect for chilly evenings, bringing warmth and festive cheer with every sip.
instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine milk and heavy cream over medium heat.
Whisk in cocoa powder and sugar until smooth and heated through.
Stir in vanilla and peppermint extracts.
Serve hot, topped with whipped cream and crushed peppermint candies.
tips: For an extra rich flavor, use dark chocolate cocoa powder instead of unsweetened.

structured_content.content: This rich peppermint hot cocoa is a delightful treat that brings the warmth of the holidays into your home. With its creamy texture and refreshing minty flavor, it's sure to become a seasonal favorite.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 20 minutes
  • Richer and creamier than store-bought versions
  • Perfect for cozy winter nights or holiday gatherings
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Customizable with your favorite toppings

structured_content.content: Every winter, my family gathers around the fireplace with mugs of this peppermint hot cocoa. It's a tradition that warms our hearts and fills our home with laughter and joy.

• Main ingredient: Whole milk and heavy cream create a luscious base that makes this cocoa ultra-creamy.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla and peppermint extracts add depth and a refreshing twist.
  • Supporting ingredients: Cocoa powder and sugar balance the flavors, making it sweet and chocolatey.
  • Equipment needed: A medium saucepan and whisk are essential for smooth mixing and heating.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Measure out all ingredients before starting to ensure a smooth cooking process.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Heat the milk and cream gently to avoid scalding, whisking continuously to combine the cocoa and sugar.
Finishing Touches:
Top with a generous swirl of whipped cream and sprinkle with crushed peppermint for a festive look.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Heat the mixture slowly to prevent burning the milk.
  • Avoid over-whisking the cocoa to keep it smooth.
  • Look for a gentle simmer to know it's ready to serve.
  • Store leftovers in the fridge and reheat gently on the stove.

structured_content.content: Sharing this hot cocoa with friends and family during the holidays is a cherished memory. It's a simple pleasure that brings everyone together.
Enhance your cocoa with a dash of cinnamon or a splash of coffee for a mocha twist. You can also experiment with flavored whipped creams for a unique touch.
Pair this hot cocoa with gingerbread cookies or a slice of peppermint bark for a festive treat. It's also delightful alongside a cozy blanket and a good book.
For a vegan version, substitute almond milk and coconut cream, and use dairy-free whipped topping. You can also try adding a shot of espresso for a mocha peppermint delight.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use high-quality cocoa powder for the best flavor.
  • Chill your serving mugs beforehand for an extra frosty treat.
  • Time your heating to ensure the cocoa is served warm but not boiling.
  • Garnish with a candy cane for an impressive presentation.

structured_content.content: Embrace the joy of making this peppermint hot cocoa and share it with loved ones. It's a simple yet delightful way to celebrate the season!
